website_summaries.verdict: This graphics card from EVGA makes it easy to enjoy all-new levels of immersion, speed, and pure power while running your favorite 4K-capable games. If your gaming PC absolutely needs to render the best visuals available, this is the one for you.
pros: Real-time ray tracing technology for superior lighting visuals
cons: Like all of the other graphics cards capable of displaying gorgeous 4K gameplay, this is an expensive item

customer_reviews.title: Really Amazon?  No bubble filler AT ALL?
customer_reviews.text: I can order a pizza cutter and the package will come fully loaded w/ bubble filler but, apparently an $800 graphics card isn’t worthy of the same treatment. Get it together.
customer_reviews.author: RonJon715

customer_reviews.title: Amazing card, but wait a few months till you buy it
customer_reviews.text: This card really is impressive, I've put every high end game to the test and honestly I miss seeing a number below 60FPS. But there is 1 problem, games that use Unreal Engine can't quite keep up with this card. Yes, you heard me correct. This card is so advanced that games using Unreal engine will crash. In order to fix this I had to underclock my card. And 1 warning to those who buy this card, the fans will not run until the card reaches 60C. In theory this is good, but sometimes the fans just won't run even over 60C. You have to install a driver only for this card to take that setting off, NVIDIA Precision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid gaming card. About what I expected. It can handle any game thats out right now with 70+FPS highest settings with an i7 8700k CPU. Very clean design and nice LED lighting features. Although, keep in mind its still a new release card, the software is very glitchy with this card and can cause weird lighting problems. So go and find the correct version to use for lighting optimisation (older version of EVGA precision). Insane gpu, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Parrish

customer_reviews.title: 1060 vs 2080
customer_reviews.text: been waiting a long time for the new cards to come out, price is a little high right now but if you can afford it why not. it made no sense to me to pay a little less to get a gtx 1080ti, and i didn't need a 2080 ti so i bought this card instead. so far i am very happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card to own
customer_reviews.text: Incredible performance! The packaging was nice. Playing games like Players Unknown's BattleGrounds and getting well over 60fps at ultra settings with temps at 55c. The RGB light on the side it's very cool.Overall good card. Didnt get 5 stars because the EVGA software does not work with 2080s. The fans will not spin under their software. Only Msi afterburner beta Works to get this cards fans spinning
customer_reviews.author: Cody Pudlish

customer_reviews.title: Should be a little bit cheaper
customer_reviews.text: nice card by evga, but a little bit expensive poor package with no airbag protection by amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lau C.

customer_reviews.title: Best option for Ray tracing without gimping performance
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this card after realizing how expensive the 1080ti has become and seeing that the rtx 2080 performed better than the 1080ti. That said I'm very happy with the performance. I can play in 4k at 60 fps in several games with max settings but there are more games that require being dropped to 2k on order to maintain 60fps, but that's still a massive improvement over my old 970. This particular card seems to have no problem running at full performance for several hours with only air cooling in the case as well. I should mention that I'm using this card with an i7-9700k as I was getting bottleneck with an i7-3770.
customer_reviews.author: Drox

customer_reviews.title: The card did not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on the same day as the delivery but it worked for 5 hours and then I had to call evga because the monitor was blinking green and the computer was turned off. I put my 1060 and working as normal, here was that I decided to return it to see how the other arrives that they will send me that in September it takes two days to send the lable to resend it and from 1 to 3 days so you can receive it , for you to take this advice, this is my first bad experience that I have with evga. I hope this does not happen to you.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Great card.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously it's overpriced out the ass because of Nvidia but other than that the card is amazing. I was hoping for a 1080ti but at this point they're more expensive than the 2080 for only a little better performance so here we are and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: David Dunigan

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully simple and sleek card card. Does everything I want it to do at 1080p and 1440p at fps averages well above 60. I haven't really gotten into 4K so I'm not too concerned. I'm mostly excited for RTX and DLSS tech to flex its muscles eventually. It's about 20% better than my GTX 1080 and something along the lines of 30% better than my Vega 56. The card is practically silent, I hardly ever see the fans come on during day to day tasks. During gaming the card stays cool and silent still while offering great performance. The only other notable thing would be the fact that the card is "thicc" and takes up three slots.
customer_reviews.author: waldensa1

customer_reviews.title: About 30% faster than  a GTX 1080.
customer_reviews.text: Runs cool (biggest limiter on consumer cards) and quiet on idle. I swapped the rad fan for a silent pressure fan from Arctic, now the card is basically inaudible when not gaming. Use something like MSI Afterburner to add about 500-700 Mhz on vram clock (use 3d mark to see if its stable, then max out temp and power sliders (dont touch voltage) and the card will boost to around 2-2.1ghz without problems. If you know how to use the oc scanner, run it and apply the curve oc once its done. Now max voltage and enjoy..
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: This video card is a BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 980ti and have seen a massive improvement in performance in "graphics demanding" games such as Ghost Recon Wildlands, Shadow of War, and Black Ops 4. I would definitely recommend this card for anyone running a 2k or 1080p monitor. If you want to run at 4k go for a 2080ti.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: ARTIFACTS THERE AND HERE AND THERE AND HERE AND EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: Whenever you pass 2000mhz clock speed it will artifact. My rtx 2070 can do stable 2070mhz. I asked for a replacement now and will update about the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Lee

customer_reviews.title: Buy for the speed, not the RGB lighting.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fast graphics card. It says pretty cool, and has a metal heatspreader on the backside. The RGB lighting however leaves a lot to be desired. It can only be controlled through the EVGA software, and there are only a few limited profiles to select from, each with very limited speed options. There is no way to sync the lighting with other (non-EVGA) devices. The white color is also a dull blue. The actual Lighting is from what appears to be one or two LEDs at on edge of the fans. So the fans to not fully illuminate, and you can clearly see one LED is brighter than the other.
customer_reviews.author: ZapD

customer_reviews.title: Died After 5 days
customer_reviews.text: I got this card and it worked great for the first 5 days then mid-game it completely died and stopped working. Tried everything possible with drivers and from a software perspective. Evga is sending me a new one, but first I have to ship it back and pay $50 for shipping then wait for them to send me a new one so by the time I hopefully have a functioning one it will be a couple more weeks. Unfortunate experience with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Filipowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: It’s a large and powerful card from Nvidia and it does not disappoint. The RTX2080 absolutely shreds nearly every current game at max settings. The performance is remarkable having upgraded from a GTX980 which was still shredding games pretty well. I bought mine right before the Super version came out. While the Super may be a better bang for the buck I am content with my purchase. Depending on the promotion, mine came with a copy of Wolfenstein: Young Blood to showcase the cards ray trancing ability. Throughout the duration of the game at max settings I noticed no perceivable dip in performance and the game looked beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Ding Dansen

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Love this card! I am an enthusiast and upgraded my 1070 Ti that was also an EVGA to this and am getting about 40% faster performance overall. I have a 9900k and 48GB 3200Mhz RAM for reference. I mostly am playing VR games these days with a Samsung HMD Odyssey VR headset and this thing has made it so that I can crank up the settings and supersampling on all the games I play to very high/ultra levels. This thing cools really well and overclocks like a beast. I did get a bit of sag from how fat/heavy the heatsink is, but was able to easily remedy this using a support I bought online.
customer_reviews.author: FoxQT

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked flawlessly out of the box like every EVGA graphics card I've purchased. This card can push the Witcher 3 at 140+ fps with ultra graphics at 1080p no problem. You should have no trouble running anything at high frame rates and comes with the NVLink port. For those looking for the promo code for Wolfenstein and control it came in an email about a day after it delivered but you can contact Amazon and they can give it to you as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Truffle

customer_reviews.title: Runs all games tested smoothly 1440p monitor, 8700k CPU, 16gb RAM
customer_reviews.text: Went with EVGA due to their customer service and quality. No problems with the card so far. I plugged it in 2 days after finishing the build and it installed without issue, including the subsequent driver installation. It arrived about 9 days after purchasing it (with the free amazon shipping). A day after getting the item, I received the e-mail from Amazon for the Battlefield 5 code, which the game runs smoothly at max graphics quality. Perfectly happy with this model opposed to the $50 more XC Ultra Gaming Pro: Games run smooth as butter. Battlefield 5 included. It's EVGA. Cons: Price
customer_reviews.author: NeedMoreSleep

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad card, upgraded from a 1080
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is the high idle temps AND the biggest flaw of all whilst idling, the fans do a weird kick on over and over again ever 5-10 seconds and you can hear the fan it sounds like a HDD loading. Nvidia needs to fix this in the driver, or maybe I got trolled and got a bad set of fans on my card? Not sure. With headphones on it isn't noticeable whatsoever but when you have them off you'll be annoyed every second.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Allen

customer_reviews.title: Darn good RTX card.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ and seeing ray tracing in Anthem is pretty awesome. Works great and I can run games at 4K resolution at 60 fps without even overclocking my GPU, CPU, or even memory. Also, the extra thick heatsink ensure the card runs at decent temps to avoid overheating. Only had it a few days, but EVGA make pretty reliable products as I have had other cards from them with little to no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody Special

customer_reviews.title: No DVI Output
customer_reviews.text: It should be pointed out in the main description at the top of the page which outputs are included on the card. I assumed that it would include a DVI output like my 1080. I imagine that many people that are going to buy a 2080 this early are also running 144hz monitors. It might be a great card, but I wouldn't know since I'm downgraded to 60hz (first world problem) while I'm waiting for a DisplayPort cable. I would've happily bought the cable when I ordered the card if I had known it didn't have a DVI output.
customer_reviews.author: jortizmn

customer_reviews.title: it does not "just works" as promissed
customer_reviews.text: DLSS sucks and DXR needs more muscle to be real-time, this is NVIDIA's fault, not EVGA's. Overall performance is good and keeps good temps, too bad there are not replacement fans available to purchase. Take it as a constructive criticism on the lack of fans for purchase EVGA. I'm still skeptical to put liquids on an expensive PC.
customer_reviews.author: Genaro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for VR with Multi-Monitor Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Have this card along with a 1080GTX in the same machine. Not SLi, serving the alienware 34" curved monitor, 2x VR HMDs, (HTC Vive, and Odyssey) for VR simming, and 4 other monitors. Just amazing! I no longer need to unplug monitors to use VR. Only bad thing is that the price point for the features. The clock speed isn't all that more powerful than a 1080 and the advertised features are not yet present in 90% of the games out there so far.
customer_reviews.author: Warfaire

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pricey, no doubt, but damn do you get the frames. I can run most games on high or ultra at 1440p from around 100 - 165 fps, depending on the game. Not only that, but the card stays very cool (below 70 degrees) with the fans only running at 25% in game, so very silent if you want it to be. It also looks baller, rgb capability on the text, the size of the heatsink looks bitchin', and the top bracket has a cool design. Recommended if you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great video card, drivers have issues.
customer_reviews.text: After many years, I've finally upgraded to this card. While I do like the overall performance improvements, the drivers have had issues! The drivers have been receiving updates and should be fixed soon. I previously was running a 980GTX and went from 60FPS to 120-200 FPS, depending on the title. As to the LED, I care not for lights on hardware, I pay for practical performance, extra cash for vanity is not my priority.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT use Micron Memory!
customer_reviews.text: Whether you hate or love the RTX line, i'm sure a lot of you enthusiasts out there know about the deadline RTX cards that have been being pushed through with the Micron GDDR6 (and if you don't go do some quick research on it!). This card is one of the ones that have been switched over. Mine (delivered 16 January) has Samsung memory installed. +100 core clock, +800 memory clock, and absolutely no stuttering, artifacting, or crashing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This card ****ing rocks! Depending what you're upgrading from.
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I've herd all the controversy surrounding this card. Including the horrendous FPS's when RTX is turned on. But overall, this thing is still a beast when upgrading from a 1070 or lower. So unless you're rocking a 1080ti, then make the jump. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Cortez

customer_reviews.title: It kinda works.
customer_reviews.text: After a few hours of use, the fans begin to turn on and off with a scraping noise. The card cannot run GTA V Dying Light, or many games I've tried on high settings smoothly at 1920 x 1080p. Frame rates will often stay at an unstable 40 unless at med settings where it is still somewhat unstable. Anyone have a recommendation on solutions or is this a hardware thing?
customer_reviews.author: Grant C

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing gpu
customer_reviews.text: Though the card is expensive, I really needed a new gpu since I had a R9 390. When I ran it in a single card config, my mind was blown by the difference of the performance. But when I tested the nvlink, some games that I ran was screen splitting. And the solution that I found to fix those games to stop, was to change the resolution of those games. Now the cards are working like a charm and I am really happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent EVGA RTX 2080 FTW3 Ultra 3 fan GPU with huge heatsink
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best performing RTX 2080 video cards you can get. EVGA's huge and heavy heatsink is uber effective with the EVGA ICX 3 fan cooling shroud. Short of a liquid cooled solution, this is the very best cooling you can get on air. Some folks buying this card may want to prevent or deal with GPU sag by getting a bracket to prevent or fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: HockeyBuck

customer_reviews.title: XC ULTRA is huge, check your case before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Great packaging and an excellent looking card. Just know, this GPU (XC ULTRA) is massive! Make sure you measure you case. Con.... EVGA software (Precision XOC) does not work properly, and won’t address the RGB lighing... hopefully they fix this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Screaming fast!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card. Running alongside and i9 9900k with 32g and runs COD at full settings at the max FPS the game allows!! Note that it comes with liquid cooling a double fan setup so you need room in your case to fit two fans together.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Loud!
customer_reviews.text: PRO: The Hybrid runs cool, and it's cheaper and easier to install than a custom loop. CON: The pump's noise on my Hybrid is almost unbearable. I have a pump from the Corsair 115i AIO's pump and 3x 140 fans running, and when they're all running on 100%, I can't hear them over the GPU pump. I feel the need to wear noise cancelling headphones at my computer and shut it down when I'm not using it. On web forums, it seems people think the pump isn't great and it's always running at 100%. I'm moving to a custom loop to douse this thing's noise.
customer_reviews.author: Alan MN

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: So far love it. It has built in leds that can easily be controlled through precision X. Runs Monster Hunter on full max no problem. Very quiet. Really big, make sure you have room. Running a full tower is no problem but anything less you might want to measure and make sure you have room. Almost 2x as thick as my old 980 and just as long maybe longer. Requires 650w power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: No words can say how much i enjoy this hybrid card. The cooling makes for great fps. I know there are mixed feelings concerning the gpu, but as i see it, it workds great for my needs and the cooling is a great bonus.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: For the price, this card is a steal!
customer_reviews.text: With the price drop that comes with the announcement of the RTX 2080 Super variants, this card absolutely kills! Being a custom PCB (FTW3) it comes overclocked already, and I even added an extra 110 MHz on the core and an extra 1000MHz on the memory and the hottest I get is around 50-55 Celsius! Overall the card runs cool and performs excellent, even in demanding titles with Ray tracing enabled! Definitely worth a buy if its around $700-$750!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top level performance for top dollars
customer_reviews.text: AMD is sucking bad and lets nVidia price things however they like. But after 2 years, if you want real upgrade over a GTX1070, I just had to give in and get the RTX2080.
customer_reviews.author: Tachikoma

customer_reviews.title: the updated drivers not working  still black screen?
customer_reviews.text: I installed evewrything and got a black screen. I removed the card and everything works again. so this time I installed the drivers before putting the card in and nothing . I dont think it s my computer .
customer_reviews.author: computer gezz

customer_reviews.title: 2nd unit to die in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm overall a fan of nvidia but this model has some issues. I. Bought this and it gave me staggered lines and became unrecognized by my os after 6 weeks. I replaced, at my cost, with an identical unit. It lasted 6 days before it just completely shut down. Aittle research seems to indicate a wave of similar reports on this model. I wont be purchasing a third unit
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my GTX970 on my I5 6600K system with 16G of DDR4-2100 RAM. Using a $4K 60Hz monitor, I wanted to make sure my frame rate drop in most games that I am playing did not drop much below 60Hz on ultra settings. The GTX970 would drop to much to my liking, often below 30FPS. Works as expected even on the latest game titles for me using resolutions beyond 1440P. I typically run 3840 x 2160 in most game titles.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph M Harris

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, nothing but hardware issues.
customer_reviews.text: This graphics card was defective out of the box. This card was used on a brand new pc build and was presenting hardware issues. The error this card was having was described as Code 43. EVGA was contacted and a replacement graphics card was sent to me. EVGA does not send a brand new unit, they only send refurbished units via RMA. After less than two months the replacement card is having issues as well (Code 43). I was denied an upgrade and offered to pay the difference. The third replacement is being delivered, I hope that it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Solid GPU for Gaming at 1440p and 3D Rendering with Lumion etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fast GPU. I am coming from an EVGA GTX 1070 FTW and this thing rips through 1440p gaming as it should with framerates above 80fps (except Battlefield V with DXR on Medium). Reliable and stable so far as expected from EVGA product.
customer_reviews.author: Zeph

customer_reviews.title: great card for its price
customer_reviews.text: 2080 is pretty nice. upgraded from 1070 and see noticeable differences.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: So far good
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but works great. I have to limit some games FPS when it gets over 100 on some games as the heat of the card will go up, on my acer preadator 27" as I like to let it stay around 50c. (watercooled)
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 5700xt to upgrade from a 1070 it did well just overheated a bit to much, decided to pull the trigger on the 2080 and I could not be more happier, extremely quite and with evga version of afterburner can adjust fan speed to reduce thermals, also able to adjust the rgb to mach the rest of my system, as for the 5700xt going to use it for a future amd build. Also the ray tracing is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Adan Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Amazing card for my 1440 system
customer_reviews.text: Badass card that’s a beast. Very expensive but I’m ok with that. Still cheaper than the 2080ti. Easily overclocked it with MSI Afterburner and paired with an overclocked 8700k. Update: Card is still super fast and cool. Does have a weird grind sound when pc turns on but I’ve read that everywhere and doesn’t seem to be causing an issue. Now I wish I could have held out for the upcoming Super-series but that’s the fun of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dance

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend this card anymore. Card is defective after just a little more than 2 months of use. Now having to get a replacement and wait probably 2 weeks or more for another or feed evga more of my money to get it sooner. I've done paid enough for it. Shouldn't have to pay more cause you have no quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worth it? I think so!
customer_reviews.text: Evga sells this on there website for 45$ cheaper but I do not believe if they ship for free. But great product. I didn’t have any errors out of the box and he item was shipped respectfully and was able to use it right away. But it’s a top line card so it’s going to be pricy to get what you want
customer_reviews.author: Kouki Chrisp

customer_reviews.title: A costy beast, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful card. A bit heavy so a purchase of any GPU holder to avoid sag and damage to the MB port is a must in my opinion. No issues so far with this product. Only downside obviously is the price tag. Way to much, but it is what it is. If AMD cards didn't get so hot and loud I'll totally go for them.
customer_reviews.author: Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Early Review
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing a ton of research on what card I wanted to upgrade to and have see mixed reviews. Coming from a 970 I can say this was a great decision. I know its overpriced at the moment but its really only $100 more than your 1080ti If you can find one. Performance wise its amazing. I am maxing out at 2k and the fps's are great. I have yet to have any heating issues but will keep an eye on it as it was an initial concern.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Fast FPS GPU
customer_reviews.text: Stupid fast FPS for my sons Gaming PC! I went with EVGA because of other reviews about good customer support if needed. So far he is very happy with the performance of this card.... I would be happy with a lower price, wishful thinking, right?
customer_reviews.author: ECK

customer_reviews.title: now i can play games above 100 fps on ultra and epic settings in 2019
customer_reviews.text: i had to get this as part of an upgrade and it's been an absolute joy to see the performance gains. some cases won't fit it! so make sure u have at least 3 slots of removable pci in your case before you purchase this. i used a corsair obsidian 750d airflow edition case.
customer_reviews.author: Jinn

customer_reviews.title: Insanely Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this card from an old GTX 780, and the difference is night and day. I went from barely getting 30-40 fps in Shadow of the Tomb Raider on the lowest quality to getting in the 70-80 range on Ultra! With an aggressive fan curve, and modest oc (+105 core using oc scanner) the card never gets over 72c. The price is up there, but considering the performance increase I got coming from my previous $650 card, the price is a little easier to swallow. I highly recommend this card to anyone looking to upgrade from 700, or 900 series card. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Whitt

customer_reviews.title: BIGLY HUGE
customer_reviews.text: This GPU is huge and will handle anything you can throw at it. The cooler is amazing - with an aggressive fan curve I can play games at 1440p max settings (Destiny 2, Witcher 3, Apex Legends) and the card doesn't go over 61*C. It's expensive yes, but it is POWERFUL.
customer_reviews.author: eisforawesome

customer_reviews.text: Brought the card use... coming from 1080 I enjoyed the graphics but update to 2080 ti.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hills

customer_reviews.title: Great card, although pricey
customer_reviews.text: The card lives up to the hype. Very quiet with outstanding UHD performance. EVGA has always served me well in the past with the quality of their cards. Purchased from Amazon due to faster free shipping. For those wanting a high performance card for a gaming rig, I highly recommend this card.
customer_reviews.author: Tony O

customer_reviews.title: Great card.
customer_reviews.text: This card is fantastic. I have had it for about 6 months or so and it runs great. The noise is hardly noticable, the performance is great and the fans hardly come on as it doesnt heat up much. The backplate is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy L.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I mean..... Would you expect any less from EVGA? This card handles overclocks like it's nothing especially with the nice and chunky heatsink. However, I've noticed that the memory gets noticeably hotter under loads than the GPU itself so it's best to always look at temperatures with the ICX feature in the EVGA X1 application.
customer_reviews.author: LezarOne

customer_reviews.title: excellent card but
customer_reviews.text: the card will sometimes make a strange whistling noise when certain games are played. this happened almost from the beginning. perhaps my card was slightly defective, but i've had it for over a year and it still works very well. powerful card that handles anything i throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast, cool and great for 1440p 144hz.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the performance and temperature. Always go EVGA for Nvidia and Sapphire AMD. Paired with the zen 3700x it easily maxes any game i throw at it. The ray tracing was not even a factor in my decision to buy it however the DLSS that the tensor cores can be used for in some games is a great performance boost and hopefully further supported more so in the future. I won't be enabling any ray tracing in any games with this card a 2080ti probably couldn't even do ray tracing with acceptable fps. But if you're looking for a 1440p card this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing video card
customer_reviews.text: This video card takes everything I can throw at it no problems whatsoever only thing I don’t like is that it only has one HDMI port So I couldn’t use the extra monitor that I had nor the TV that I had to watch YouTube on the side
customer_reviews.author: Mervan R.

customer_reviews.title: Will run Doom 5/5
customer_reviews.text: This is a great GPU I’ve been using it heavily for about 6 months now. It does amazingly on every game I have, including my VR games. I can confirm also, it will run Doom.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: and 6 months later, its dead
customer_reviews.text: This is my second EVGA video card to die in the last 7 months. I have been a loyal fan of their products, from motherboards to power supplies, but my faith is being tested. Contacted customer service two days ago and haven't heard anything back. Guess they must be too busy.
customer_reviews.author: RomRock

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used, came defective. Return shipping took a really long time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather F

customer_reviews.title: Card died like 8 months after installation
customer_reviews.text: Without any warning or rhyme or reason to it. The ONLY reason it doesn't have a 1 star review is because they accepted it for an RMA and gave me a FTW3 instead which is a slight upgrade. I somewhat expect that to need to be RMA'd in about the same period of time as well tbh.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Weird fan grinding noise
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the GPU works great other than when i put it under a higher load than just sitting at the desktop, it makes a weird grinding sound. It's super load and pretty annoying honestly. Idk if it's just mine or not.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Alfonso

customer_reviews.title: Customer support is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: My RTX 2080 is amazing, BUT more importantly- so is their customer support! Had an issue with my computer and Mr. Turner from their technical support squared me away! So nice having a person to speak to instead of online FAQ and automated calls. California based too! WILL buy from again!
customer_reviews.author: Jose luis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Video Card
customer_reviews.text: This card runs all my games at ultra settings at 1080p on a 144hz monitor around 110 FPS average. Benchmarked Farcry 5 on ultra settings getting 120 frames to low as 90 frames. When idle runs at 55c. During game it runs at 65 to 70c
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne E Seeley

customer_reviews.title: Good card for gaming
customer_reviews.text: So far a good card, bought the Evga waterblock for it from them and looks great. Currently using it with 2 Dell 27" 1440 144mhz G-sync monitors and everything looks and plays great. Compared to how much a 2080ti is I'm satisfied. Decent fps on Destiny 2 and Battlefield 5.
customer_reviews.author: Michal

customer_reviews.title: Cold as ice, willing to sacrifice 3 slots.
customer_reviews.text: Great card, great price point. Installed it and updated the drivers, then played a couple games, started to worry because the fans never turned on. So I ran some graphics benchmarks and they finally came on. Card runs super cool even under high load. Takes up 3 pci slots but absolutely worth it. Highly recommend this card. Also, didn’t have any of the problems getting the 3 free games included.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great GPU. But for nearly 800 dollars I would expect excellence. A few games I play stutter on lower settings however this GPU can handle almost everything I throw at it. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JAMS

customer_reviews.title: Produces a constant ticking noise as the fans flip on and off.
customer_reviews.text: This card is meant to have its fans turn off at low temps, but when it has mid range temps the fans flip on and off every minute or so. Each time the fans start it makes a loud ticking noise.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Great card for 4k performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for a client to run four 43 inch 4K ViewSonic monitors. As you can see from the set up they performed exactly how they should and they keep up with everything he wants to do.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Died after a week.
customer_reviews.text: Good video card worked great for a week ,100+ fps with the proper computer parts. Would be 4 or 5 stars if the video card hadn't died. Keep in mind I paired this with all brand new computer parts as well. Was playing the Division 2 and the video card died midst playing after nearly a week of usage. Popped in my three year old GTX 1050 and the computer started working fine again. Going through the RMA process now and will update if the card fails yet again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU :D
customer_reviews.text: The Evga RTX 2080 XC runs all my games on ultra settings and are smooth. I did buy the Hybrid kit to keep it cooler. I upgraded from a Msi r9 390.
customer_reviews.author: Acze Perez

customer_reviews.title: Product came as described
customer_reviews.text: Product was "open box" status, so was discounted as compared to a new item. The GPU was otherwise brand new and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Great Guy

customer_reviews.title: Troublesome
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, cannot run Warzone on max graphics, horrible screen tears and fluid/oil leaking from somewhere. See pics
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Amazing GPU
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card, though it’s a bit more expensive, I got my money’s worth as it was my first build with it. Cools very well on my thermaltake core v1 case, I’m getting around 75 - 78 degrees under stress load which is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Haitham Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Great card! Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a gtx 1060 6gb card. Worth the upgrade! Great card, overclocks well, not super loud unless you have fans at 100% and it plays all games at ultra setting at 1080p at 100+ fps, some games im getting 300 fps.
customer_reviews.author: bass-a-holic

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: What an impressive piece of technology, I've been thoroughly enjoying gaming with this gfx card. Haven't had any issues with playing anything.
customer_reviews.author: Masta

customer_reviews.title: Very loud
customer_reviews.text: If you have don't have sound cancelling headphones don't bother waste money on the loudest thing you can put in your system. I've had evga's 980ti hybrid and 1080ti hybrid and the 2080 takes the cake for the loudest of the three. Please fix this EVGA in the next iteration. I do not intend to make the next upgrade to 3000 series if this problem remains
customer_reviews.author: Diana Laura

customer_reviews.title: Runs like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: My old EVGA 1080TI caught fire. For realsies. Had to replace it, and the 2080 benched as good as a replacement 1080 TI, which was also equally priced. If RTX works in the future on some great games, I'm ready for it. If not, I'm at even sum. Still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Vektra

customer_reviews.title: Works good so far
customer_reviews.text: Overall the card works and keeps cool even though airflow in my case isn't fantastic, the only complaint i have is a couple of fins on the cooler are a tad bent kinda sucks for such an expensive product other than that it works great
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Works gud after clean installing windows
customer_reviews.text: Installed it with an EKWB liquid cooling cover. Had all kinds of crashing and blue screens when I first put it in, which all kinds of "fixes" and driver installing/uninstalling did not fix. Finally resorted to clean installing Windows, and it works gud now.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Overall almost perfect, haven't received a free game code.
customer_reviews.text: Performance is insane. Looks great, software let's it automatically adjust the LEDs based on it's temperature. 1 star removed because it didn't come with a game code...a 2080 without a game code??? Even the half price cards come with a game. Waiting on response from seller regarding code.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Moore

customer_reviews.title: Epic Graphics, Super Quiet, Zero Problems
customer_reviews.text: As someone who upgraded from a GTX 970 i cant even begin to explain how fantastic this card is. Super quiet. Zero problems. Epic graphics. Well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Meserve

customer_reviews.title: too hot
customer_reviews.text: When computer is just powered on and not doing anything, the card is too hot to touch... worried it might damage mobo.. =(
customer_reviews.author: Sam Arutyunyan

customer_reviews.title: Its so beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: My computer is a beast and this pricey guy helps it both functionally and aesthetically. I am a huge fan of EVGA and NVIDIA. If you can afford it I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David A M

customer_reviews.title: great 4k gaming card
customer_reviews.text: With my set up, I currently can run non-rtx games at 4k with 60fps+. Quiet card after heavy usage, but can run hot, what graphic card doesn't? Overall great card to have! not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn P.

customer_reviews.title: ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Hard to tell a difference coming from a 1080. Think I'll wait longer next time before I upgraded again.
customer_reviews.author: nimbice

customer_reviews.title: This thing spanks
customer_reviews.text: For the enthusiasts that doesn’t want to spend over a grand. I use a 144hz 1440P monitor and this keeps up with all of the latest titles pushing over 120FPS on ultra settings. Apex looks amazing, spend your money here kids
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Smoking fast
customer_reviews.text: I have a i5 6600k & 1080p 144hz monitor and its at a solid 100 fps + on high/ultra settings on any game I play! Smooth as butter!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trembath

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: With my setup i run everything 100+fps on max graphics. i have it set to cap out at 120 with my monitor. DVI cable installed
customer_reviews.author: Manuel De La Puente

customer_reviews.title: Fast and cool
customer_reviews.text: Overclocked 1400 on memory...145mhz on the core @ +7% voltage. A bit loud at 100% fan speed but of course it is. 3 year warranty is nice. A 1440p beast.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Serious gaming card
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son and he is really happy with the performance and features. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ola Svensson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance and fluency
customer_reviews.text: delivery speed is very fast. After I received it, I installed the computer and lit it once. The computer runs perfectly, very smoothly, without any cartons. Unfortunately, the zen2 was released shortly after I bought it. So use it, and upgrade zen3 later.
customer_reviews.author: dango

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It is a big GPU I opted for the bigger heatsink one for less noise and temps. Works great and looks great inside of my pc. Not disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MericaGetSome

customer_reviews.title: bad end of the stick
customer_reviews.text: I never want to play a game again to wander if it's the game or my newly bought graphics card that's causing a delay I didn't have no problems with my older graphics card
customer_reviews.author: rickey

customer_reviews.title: absolute monster
customer_reviews.text: Id give it 5 stars but i had a ton of driver issues to begin with, once i got it all settled though this thing is a monster.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: EVGA GeForce RTX 2080 XC ULTRA GAMING, 8GB GDDR6, Dual HDB Fans & RGB LED Graphics Card 08G-P4-2183-KR
product_meta.description: Style:Graphics Card, UltraThe EVGA GeForce RTX 20-Series Graphics Cards are powered by the all-new NVIDIA Turing architecture to give you incredible new levels of gaming realism, speed, power efficiency, and immersion. With the EVGA GeForce RTX 20-Series gaming cards you get the best gaming experience with next generation graphics performance, ice cold cooling, and advanced overclocking features with the all new EVGA Precision X1 software. The new NVIDIA GeForce RTX GPUs have reinvented graphics and set a new bar for performance. Powered by the new NVIDIA Turing GPU architecture and the revolutionary NVIDIA RTX platform, the new graphics cards bring together real-time ray tracing, artificial intelligence, and programmable shading. This is not only a whole new way to experience games - this is the ultimate PC gaming experience.
feature_bullets: Real Boost Clock: 1815 MegaHertZ; Memory Detail: 8192MB GDDR6, Memory Bit Width: 256 Bit , Memory Bandwidth: 448 GB/s
Dual HDB fans and all new 2. 75 slot cooler offers higher performance cooling and much quieter acoustic noise
Adjustable RGB LED offers configuration options for all your PC lighting needs
Built for EVGA Precision x1, EVGA all new tuning utility monitors your graphics card and gives you the power to overclock like a Pro
Get grip game + EVGA vehicle skin w/ Purchase, redeemed at EVGA website, while supplies last

specifications.Series: GeForce RTX 2080 Graphic Card - 1.82 GHz Boost Clock - 8 GB GDDR6
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars468 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
